message: Hello Bob, thank you for considering my product. I think it's a great opportunity for you to acquire a valuable asset. I'm willing to sell it to you for $12,000.
I appreciate the offer, but I was thinking more along the lines of $9,000. I really like the product, but I have to stay within my budget.

I understand your budget constraints, Bob. However, I think the product's value is higher than $9,000. I'm willing to meet you halfway and sell it to you for $10,500. This is a fair price considering the product's worth to you.
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to go up to $9,500, but that's as high as I can go.

I understand your budget constraints, Bob. I'm willing to compromise further. I'll sell the product to you for $10,000, which is the price John is willing to pay. This is the best offer I can make, considering the product's value to you.
I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but I'm still trying to stay within my budget. I'm willing to meet you halfway again, so I'll offer $9,750. This is the highest price I'm willing to pay.

I understand your budget constraints, Bob. However, I've already compromised significantly, and I'm getting close to my minimum price. I'll sell the product to you for $9,900, which is still a good deal considering the product's value to you.

I appreciate your understanding of my budget constraints, but I'm still trying to get the best deal possible. I'm willing to go up to $9,500, but that's as high as I can go. I'm starting to get a bit frustrated with the back-and-forth, so I'd like to make a serious offer. Please consider it carefully.

I understand your frustration, Bob. I'm willing to make one final compromise. I'll sell the product to you for $9,700, which is the best I can do considering the product's value to you. This is a fair price, and I hope you'll consider it seriously.

I appreciate your final compromise, but I'm still not comfortable going above $9,500. I'm willing to meet you at that price, but I'm not going any higher. I'm starting to think that I might be better off buying from John at $8,000. Please consider this as my final offer.
